title: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description:
When editing XML Report Designer in the editor, a message is displayed saying 'Dirty Page' along with the following options: 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel'. This message prevents the user from accessing other pages until the changes are saved. The user is then left to figure out how to save or discard their changes. The dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).

A better and more typical approach would be to inform the user that the XML Report Design has been changed and provide clear options for saving or discarding the changes. The dialog should use a better title and should not include the quotes.
OB: 'Dirty Page' message is displayed with options 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel'. Other pages cannot be accessed until changes are saved. The dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).
EB: When the XML Report Design is modified, a dialog should be displayed providing clear options for saving or discarding the changes. The dialog should have a more appropriate title and should not include quotes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer in the editor.
2. Make changes to the report.
3. Observe the 'Dirty Page' message with options 'Yes', 'No', and 'Cancel'.
4. Attempt to access other pages.
5. Note that the dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).
